name: Lodspeakr

body:
### What is LODSPeaKr?

LODSPeaKr is a small and simple system that allows you to publish your RDF data in a fast way and without much effort. LODSPeaKr allows you to publish your data in several machine-processable syntaxes (RDF/XML, Turtle, N-Triples) as well as in HTML.

### Why another system for publishing LOD?

There are several alternatives available, however I needed a system that:

* Was fast and simple to install.
* Flexible on what to show for each type of resource.
* Customizable interface for humans.
* Written in PHP.

### How do I install LODSPeaKr?

In order to use LODSPeaKr, you only need Apache + PHP5 + Git (optional but highly recommended). It also makes use of [ARC2](https://github.com/semsol/arc2) and [Haanga](https://github.com/crodas/Haanga) (included in LODSPeaKr). There are several ways to install LODSPeaKr. Probably the easiest is to open a terminal and run

```
bash < <(curl -sL http://lodspeakr.org/install)
```

and follow the instructions. For more information, please go to the installation page and check the requirements if you don't get your system working after completing the installation process.

### Ok, what's next?

You can check the [Requirements needed](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/Installation) to make LODSPeaKr work, as well as some information about [other ways to install it](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/Installation). Once everything is working, you can take a look at the [wiki](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki) in general or go directly to the most basic pages:

* How to [create components](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/Creating-components-in-LODSPeaKr)
* Understanding [models](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/Models) and [views](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/Views)
* How to [use results](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/How-to-use-results)
* How to [use filters](https://github.com/alangrafu/lodspeakr/wiki/Filters-in-LODSPeaKr)
tagline: Linked Open Data Simple Publishing Kit
